title: Are Spirogyra and cyanobacteria the same? - Quora

response.answer_text: No, they are not same. Cyanobacteria also known as blue green algae because of its turquoise blue color. Cyanobacteria are prokaryotic organisms where as green algae are eukaryotic organisms. Algae are small unicellular organisms whereas cyanobacteria are multi-cellular organisms and larger in size. Both green algae and cyanobacteria have evolved from algae. Based on their structure, they are differentiated into prokaryocyte (cyanobacteria) and eukaryocyte (Spirogyra).
No…. Cyanobacteria are group of prokaryotic organisms and Spirogyra is one of those organisms.
